com.samysadi.acs.hardware.network.operation

Interface NetworkOperation

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Operation<NetworkResource>, Probed, RemoteOperation<NetworkResource>, RunnableEntity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NetworkOperationDefault

    public interface NetworkOperation
extends RemoteOperation<NetworkResource>
    This interface defines methods to simulate a data transmission operation between two Jobs through a given route in the network.

    When starting a network operation, it seeks network resource from each provisioner in the allocated Route and stays activated until its entire length is processed, until a failure happens or until it is explicitly stopped (using appropriate method).

    You must ensure that both the parent Job and the destination Job are started in order to start this operation, otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.
    If you start this operation while it has a null parent, or a null destination Job then a NullPointerException is thrown.

    If this operation has no allocated Route, then it will fail to start.
    Besides, each link in the Route must have a non null provisioner otherwise a NullPointerException is thrown.

    When activating the operation, implementations must take care to register appropriate listeners on each device on the route, and on the source and destination jobs (and VMs) to ensure that the operation is deactivated or updated accordingly when:

    • NotificationCodes.OPERATION_RESOURCE_INVALIDATED the allocated BW on the route has changed;
    • NotificationCodes.RP_ROUTING_UPDATED the route is no longer valid (ex: because a device or interface has failed).
    All implementation classes should provide a constructor with two arguments. The first argument is a Job that specifies the destination job. The second argument is a long that specifies the operation length (length of the transmission).
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

      Returns the total transmitted size (number of Simulator.BYTEs) that has effectively reached the DestinationJob.

      Returns the size in bytes (number of Simulator.BYTEs) of the data to be transmitted by this operation.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        NetworkOperation clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Operation<NetworkResource>
        Specified by:
        clone in interface RemoteOperation<NetworkResource>
        Specified by:
        clone in interface RunnableEntity

      • isRetransmitOnError

        boolean isRetransmitOnError()
        Returns true if data should be retransmitted on error.

        If false that means that the loss rate between nodes is not taken into account, which may be used to simulate communications where data integrity doesn't matter a lot.

        Returns:
        true if data should be retransmitted on error

      • getAllocatedRoute

        Route getAllocatedRoute()
        Returns the route that is assigned for this operation or null.

        null is returned if no route is assigned yet.

        Returns:
        Returns the route that is assigned for this operation or null

      • getLength

        long getLength()
        Returns the size in bytes (number of Simulator.BYTEs) of the data to be transmitted by this operation.
        Returns:
        the size in bytes (number of Simulator.BYTEs) of the data to be transmitted by this operation

      • getResourceMax

        long getResourceMax()
        Returns the maximum bw (number of Simulator.BYTEs per one Simulator.SECOND) that this operation can use.
        Returns:
        the maximum bw (number of Simulator.BYTEs per one Simulator.SECOND) that this operation can use

      • setResourceMax

        void setResourceMax(long maxBw)
        Sets the maximum bw (number of Simulator.BYTEs per one Simulator.SECOND) that this operation can use.
        The operation will never allocate more than this bw through the route.
        Default value is Long.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        maxBw -

      • getResourceMin

        long getResourceMin()
        Returns the minimum needed Bw (number of Simulator.BYTEs per one Simulator.SECOND) by the operation to be activated
        Returns:
        the minimum needed Bw (number of Simulator.BYTEs per one Simulator.SECOND) by the operation to be activated

      • setResourceMin

        void setResourceMin(long minBw)
        Sets the minimum usable Bw (number of Simulator.BYTEs per one Simulator.SECOND) by the operation to be activated.
        Parameters:
        minBw -

      • getCompletedLength

        long getCompletedLength()
        Returns the total transmitted size (number of Simulator.BYTEs) that has effectively reached the DestinationJob. This should not include the data that is being transmitted. Only the data that has been transmitted until last deactivation should be included.
        Returns:
        The total effectively transmitted size (number of Simulator.BYTEs) that has reached the DestinationJob
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the operation is active
